column4: Hello! I recenly Installed Ubuntu and had some Display issues, How do I know if the driver is actually Installed?
I have ATI Card
usually hardware drivers will show you if you're using a proprietary driver or not
yeah but it does not show anything there
does this mean there aint no proprietary drive available?
possibly yes, meaning you're probably going to be stuck with the radeon driver
yeah... maybe I was dumb installing 8.04
sometimes the free driver works better or supports older cards better than the proprietary one, this case is very true for ati chipsets
yeah... It was weird that I had to change some things in xorg to actually get the display to work

you might face similar issues if you use updated version, it all depends on your chipset.. considering you have edited xorg, are you using radeon? if so that may be the only choice available with latter versions of ubuntu on that same box
well the thing is that this is actually Kubuntu but no one answered me in that channel I just thought that it's quite the same
heh only difference between ubuntu, kubuntu, xubuntu and soon lubuntu is just a matter of different frontends.. they all share the same base more or less
I've tried ubuntu 9.10 on this computer and it worked great, however I like the old KDE more than Gnome but I hate the new KDE
is there anyway I could install Kubuntu 9.10 and still have the KDE from 8.04?
not really I'm afraid, it might work vice-versa but not easily
ok thx.... that's a shame because imo KDE has gotten alot worse over the years
you might want to give lxde a try, in some ways it looks a little similar to kde3.5
wow :D... thank you for recommending that :) I will try it Kubuntu 8.04 keeps crashing on me
lxde? np
yes :D
thank you for your help
np
